section.section:
To verify the information required in the insurer's registration statement and any addition or amendment to the registration statement, and in addition to the powers granted under §§ 2-205 through 2-209 of this article relating to the examination of insurers, the Commissioner may order an insurer subject to registration under this subtitle to produce:
those records, books, or papers in the possession of the insurer or its affiliates that are necessary to verify the registration statement; and
additional information relevant to the registration statement.
The Commissioner shall examine the materials produced under this subsection at the time and place prescribed in §§ 2-205 through 2-209 of this article.

The Commissioner may conduct an examination under subsection (a) of this section only:
if the examination of the insurer under §§ 2-205 through 2-209 of this article is inadequate, or the interests of the policyholders of the insurer are being adversely affected; and
within 3 years after the filing of the registration statement or the addition or amendment to the registration statement.
In a matter involving fraud, the 3-year limitation period of this subsection does not apply.
If reasonably necessary, the Commissioner may retain the services of an accounting firm at the insurer's expense to help in an examination under subsection (a) of this section.
An accounting firm retained under this subsection is under the direction and control of the Commissioner and acts only in an advisory capacity.

text.section: An insurer that produces materials for an examination under subsection (a) of this section is liable for and shall pay the expense of the examination in accordance with § 2-208 of this article.
